title: Data Scientist (Arabic Speaking)
description:
**Welcome to SkillLab**


At SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has a pathway to employment. We enable and lead a radical change - a focus on skill-based approach to employment services. Our AI-driven technology creates more inclusive and efficient labor markets by empowering people to turn their skills into careers. SkillLab is working with employment and career services in 25+ countries and seeks to transform labor and education markets globally.

**Your opportunity**


You will be part of an expert team in dealing with large scale data and knowledge sources (taxonomies) around occupations, skills, qualifications, educations. This data will be relevant for high quality employment services for people such as job seekers, workers, employers and/or training providers.


You’ll be mostly working in client implementation projects. Turning data into usable insights that connect with our clients level of understanding and needs is crucial for the role.

**Your team**


You will join our Data Science team as our new Data Scientist. The lead data scientist is Aaron who has many years of experience in multiple industries in data science and AI. You will work closely with Rihab, a Data Scientist who specialises in taxonomies. Her responsibilities include developing and maintaining our taxonomies' data structures, working with clients to help build their own, as well as training and evaluating NLP models. Anna is a data scientist specialising in recommendation systems.


We are proud of the people we collaborate with and excited to work at a company with a strong social mission. We hope you will be too!

**Your impact**

* You will maintain our user data, taxonomies or other datasets and actively search for more relevant datasets.
* You will communicate with the company and/or clients on AI topics in an accessible manner.
* You will obtain and manipulate required data for modelling, analysis and/or reporting purposes.
* You will support our business consultants with analysis and reports, workshops and client trainings as well as our product managers with turning data into products and/or solutions.
* You will write code to parse, process and output data.
* You are able to leverage AI and machine learning technologies and have an understanding of them.

**Requirements**

*Your skills*

* You have 2-4 years of experience as a data scientist and/ or a similar role like data analyst.
* You are an Arabic speaker.
* You are proficient in using AI techniques and supporting technologies.
* You are comfortable using Python and SQL.
* You have worked in client facing projects, turning data into insights that connect with clients' level of understanding.
* You have knowledge of data cleaning techniques as well as visualisation techniques and libraries.

**Extra awesome**

* You have experience working with occupation / skill / education taxonomies.

**Salary & start-date**

* We use a salary benchmark for the Dutch high-tech sector to set your salary based on your experience. We expect that the annual gross salary for the experience we are looking for ranges from 50k-55k Euro per year.
* We accept applications on a rolling basis, and we envision a start date as soon as possible.

**Benefits**

* You will enjoy 25 paid vacation days per year (20 days as the statutory minimum holiday entitlement in the Netherlands plus 5 extra days from SkillLab).
* You can work flexibly from our office in Amsterdam and home within the Netherlands. You can also extend your holiday stay in a different country and work from abroad for a limited period of time.
* You will get an extensive relocation support to move to Amsterdam including visa sponsorship, 30% ruling application, your plane tickets, covered real estate agent fees, first 2-weeks of hotel accommodation etc.
* You will have a personal learning budget to invest in your professional development.
* You will have access to mentors & coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator).
* You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Yourcampus app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online stores.
* You will join our bi-annual company offsite retreats in different locations like Belgium, the Netherlands etc.

**What else to know?**

* SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds. Read more about DEI at SkillLab: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/diversity-equity-and-inclusion-at-skilllab
* This is our tech stack and how we build technology with impact: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/howtostackyourtech
* Read more about our compensation framework: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/skilllab-compensation
* Get 3 tips for your job application: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/skilllabjobapplication

title: Data Analyst | Talent Program
description:
**Let’s talk talent**  
You have talent. Ready to make impact. We know. We also know that making impact starts with that first contact between likeminded people who have the same drive to shape their future. We see you, with your skills, personality and dreams. Now let’s take it to even greater heights by means of one of our talent programs for master’s and PhD graduates.

We are Mploy Associates, a talent focused consultancy firm ready to make not only our clients’ teams successful but also you. Your talent, our focus.

**More specifically?**  
We are a consultancy firm specialized in the areas of data, finance, and analytics and work on a variety of projects like investment analyses, data engineering, quant modelling and much more. Our clients are banks, insurance companies, asset managers and we are still expanding.

We help our clients build successful teams by providing the right skills, talents and know-how at the right place and time and develop ourselves continuously to stay successful. We believe that investing in talent through proven methods always pays out. Today we are proud to say that we are an international driven company with more than 100 people and many top-tier clients who share the same vision.

**How do you fit into this vision?**  
You will work as a Data Analyst for one of our clients with a special focus on your own development through one of our Talent Programs. Our Talent Programs are designed to accelerate your career from entry level to medior+ level within 24 months. By means of certified training courses, coaching and intervision sessions our employees follow an above average steep career curve. Successful graduation in our Talent Programs usually results in a permanent medior+ or senior position at one of our clients or where it becomes your responsibility to keep the team successful.

**Your activities as**  **a Data Analyst**

As a data analyst your main responsibilities will include collecting, aggregating, cleansing and interpreting large datasets. Your day-to-day responsibilities include:

* Discussing data requirements for different quantitative models or business reports;
* Making an inventory of the relevant databases within the organisation and gaining access to them;
* Merging tables and aggregating data in SQL, SAS and/or Python;
* Developing and applying relevant data quality analyses (e.g. trend, missing value, and extreme value analyses);
* Visualizing data through the development of interactive dashboards;
* Interpretation of the data by means of pattern analyses and descriptive statistics;
* Documenting the data sourcing process and descriptive statistics whilst discussing these with your stakeholders.

On average you work 36 hours a week on a client project and you spend 4 hours a week on your own personal, professional and technical development in one of our Talent Programs.

**What are we looking for?**

We are looking for graduates with different data-related backgrounds, experiences, and passions. It speaks for itself that you are ambitious, self-reflective and dare to be confident in an authentic way.

Furthermore, you are energized by stakeholder management and are well adept at gathering reliable information. You use this in combination with a consultive mindset to make our clients more successful. Last but not least, you are eager to develop yourself on personal, professional and technical level with our personalized in-house Talent Programs. To make this more specific:

* You have 0-3 years of work experience and want to learn everything about data analysis;
* You want to put into practice your skills that you have acquired during your master’s or PhD in Business Informatics, Data Science or another data related study;
* You are proficient with big data processing in SQL, Python or another relevant coding language;
* You do not hesitate to use your analytical skills to solve complex problems creatively and logically.

**What do we offer?**  
We offer the opportunity to become an expert in data analysis, in an environment where we train you to excel as a high-end professional. In addition, good working conditions are equally as important to us.

By offering free lunch at the office and regular fun team activities like escape rooms and fun dinners, we ensure a connected and social workplace. Also important; we will provide you with a public transport card and/or (electric) bike. All on us of course. Furthermore:

* A salary of €3,616 for master's graduates and €4,083 for PhD graduates, including holiday allowance and 13th month salary;
* Challenging work and projects for one of our top 200 clients;
* 25 days of paid annual leave;
* Half-day a week in-house professional and technical training combined with personal coaching;
* Besides in-house training opportunities, an external development budget of €2,000 per year to obtain relevant certifications as FRM or CFA;
* An international working environment with driven and ambitious colleagues from all over the world;
* The opportunity to take your next career move as a medior at the client or Mploy Associates after successfully completing your development program;
* Pro bono technical projects at socially relevant NGOs.

**Interested?**  
For more information about our different positions and Talent Programs you can visit our website www.mployassociates.com. Want to know more about the vacancy? Use the apply button above or send us an email from the moment you start your master’s so we can help you prepare for your dream career. We will be in touch.

Please note that unfortunately there is no point in applying when you do not live in the Netherlands or if you have more than 3 years of work experience. These applications will not be processed.

Are you interested in multiple positions at Mploy Associates? Apply for one position and mention the other position(s) in your motivation message. Together we will find the best match for you.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From €3.600,00 per month

Application Question(s):

* Are you willing to undergo a background check, in accordance with local law/regulations?
* Are you living in the Netherlands?
* Are you fulltime available?
* Do you have less than three years of relevant work experience?

Education:

* Master's (Required)

Language:

* English (Required)

Work authorization:

* Netherlands (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in 3512 LP Utrecht
company_description: We are Mploy Associates, a talent focused consulting firm ready to make not only our clients’ teams successful but also you. Your talent, our focus.

title: Marketing analyst
description:
Wil jij door middel van digitale campagnes, data en insights zorgen voor een optimale dienstverlening en klantbeleving? Ben jij Tech savvy en commercieel? Ben je toe aan een uitdagende en leerzame baan? Bij Massarius, het #1 Innovatief Advertising Agency volgens Adformatie Media Report, kan jij werken, leren en innoveren.


Over Massarius


Massarius is een publisher trading desk en maakt programmatic trading mogelijk voor middelgrote publishers. Wij zijn verantwoordelijk voor alle geautomatiseerde verkoop van hun advertentieruimte. In totaal zijn er ruim 70 publishers bij het Massarius netwerk aangesloten, dit komt neer op zo’n 100 websites met 700 miljoen advertenties per maand op desktop, mobile en video. Voorbeelden van klanten waar we voor werken staan op de website van Massarius.


Sinds 2012 zijn we enorm hard gegroeid, beloond met vijf FD Gazellen Awards, twee FinancialTimes1000 listings, #1 waarderingen bij Emerce en Adformatie. In 2020 zijn wij van Startup gegroeid naar een internationale Scale-up met kantoren in Amsterdam en Madrid en +40% groei per jaar. Dit jaar zijn we gestart in Engeland en België. Een vrij ambitieus team dus!


Wil je meer achtergrondinformatie over wat Programmatic Advertising nu precies inhoudt?

  

Jouw rol als Marketing analyst


In deze rol ben jij het aanspreekpunt voor mediabureaus en brands. Je doel is het opbouwen van relaties om zo goed mogelijk de online advertentieruimtes van onze uitgevers te vermarkten. Je maakt deel uit van het demand team en werkt nauw samen met andere collega’s om zo alles voor klanten mogelijk te maken.


Als Marketing Analyst heb je een proactieve rol en zul je onder andere verantwoordelijk zijn voor:


* Het uitbreiden en behouden van de bestaande klantrelaties.
* Het inventariseren van de informatie van Trading Desks.
* Het maken van performance rapportages en analyses
* Het inzichtelijk houden van bestedingen door mediabureaus en hun adverteerders.
* Het maken van performance rapportages en analyses.
* Een optimale klantbeleving, geen vraag is voor jou te moeilijk.

Onze ideale Marketing analyst


* Heeft WO werk- en denkniveau, dan wel HBO-niveau met 1 tot 2 jaar relevante werkervaring.
* Beschikt over een netwerk bij agencies.
* Beschikt over een nieuwsgierige instelling en is een zelfstarter.
* Is commercieel en denkt in mogelijkheden.
* Heeft een sterk analytisch vermogen en kan goed rekenen
* Heeft digitale affiniteit
* Spreekt Nederlands en Engels, Spaans is mooi meegenomen.

Wat biedt Massarius jou?


Massarius biedt je een salaris passend bij jouw kennis en ervaring met uiteenlopende verantwoordelijkheden. De leercurve die jij doorloopt, wordt ondersteund door onze zeer ervaren professionals. De werksfeer kenmerkt zich als open, direct, betrokken en resultaatgericht in een prachtige informele werkomgeving: De Jordaan.


Wil jij jouw talent met ons delen?


Wij kijken ernaar uit je te ontmoeten! Mail je CV en motivatie naar: recruiting@massarius.com

title: Senior Product Manager, Integrations
description:
#### **About the Team**


Miro aims to be the Innovation workspace, the center of gravity that enables innovation through the development of new products, services or processes. In the modern enterprise, the average user navigates 317 SaaS tools, leading to challenges like data silos, communication gaps, and tool sprawl.
The Integrations stream at Miro addresses these challenges by unifying data and workflows across disparate tools into a single collaboration platform. Our mission is to transform Miro into the single plane of glass for innovation, by unifying data and workflows across multiple disparate tools in an Enterprise's tool stack with Miro.
  

This tight, cross-functional stream comprising of Product, Design, Engineering, Marketing, Partnerships and Analytics functions achieves this by :
* Building integrations that bring data to the Miro canvas that will accelerate our customers' innovation cycle
* Building integrations within 3rd party tools that create seamless entry points for users to transition to Miro's intelligent canvas

Investing in an Integration Platform that provides the infrastructure to scale the development of integrations across a breath of tools  
* 

Miro connects with over 130+ Integrations including deep investments with strategic ecosystems such as Microsoft, Google, Salesforce, Amazon, Atlassian to name a few. Our commitment to excellent customer experience has earned us industry recognition, including the Google Cloud 2024 Technology Partner of the Year Award in Productivity and Collaboration: Innovation.
  

As a part of our Product team in the Integrations stream, you'll have the opportunity to contribute to make Miro the innovation workspace for enterprises worldwide.  


*Each role at Miro is based at one of our physical hubs, and we look for talent that wants to be part of these local, collaborative communities. Mironeers work in a hybrid model, with 2 days a week in office culture as our baseline. This role can be based anywhere in Amsterdam, Berlin or London.*

#### **About the Role**



Reporting to the Group PM for Integrations, you will be responsible for defining the strategy and delivering on the roadmap for Miro's integrations within strategic 3rd party ecosystems. You'll partner with an autonomous team of 6+ Engineers, Designer, Analyst, Marketeers, and Partnership Managers to drive success for your product scope. You'll work closely with Product and Engineering teams across Microsoft, Google, Atlassian to provide thought leadership on how to maximise value for our mutual customers through deep integrations.


#### **What you'll do**


* Work cross-functionally to deliver results with a focus on customer value
* Drive clarity and solve ambiguous tasks within your area of expertise
* Break down complex problems into solvable chunks to iteratively deliver value
* Lead complex initiatives and product launches end-to-end
* Build deep expertise and credibly articulate how customers use different tools complementary to Miro to complete their JTBD and use cases
* Build an understanding of tools across productivity suites and corresponding APIs and SDKs across different developer ecosystems

#### **What you'll need**


* 5+ years as a Product Manager
* 2 of those working directly with highly strategic customers and/or partners
* Foundational understanding of the complexities of building integrations
* Foundational understanding of APIs/SDKs, sufficient to contribute to design discussions, and to discuss technical tradeoffs with Partners and Engineers
* Foundational understanding of leveraging AI to solve user problems
* [Nice to have] Experience building for Microsoft, Google, Salesforce, Atlassian ecosystems

#### **What's in it for you**


* Competitive equity package
* Medical insurance coverage
* Lunch, snacks and drinks provided in the office
* Wellbeing benefit and WFH equipment allowance
* Annual learning and development allowance to grow your skills and career
* Travel allowance for your commute
* Opportunity to work for a globally diverse team
* Inspiring workplace in the heart of Amsterdam

#### **About Miro**



Miro is a visual workspace for innovation that enables distributed teams of any size to build the next big thing. The platform's infinite canvas enables teams to lead engaging workshops and meetings, design products, brainstorm ideas, and more. Miro, co-headquartered in San Francisco and Amsterdam, serves more than 60M users worldwide, including 99% of the Fortune 100. Miro was founded in 2011 and currently has more than 1,800 employees in 12 hubs around the world.



We are a team of dreamers. We look for individuals who dream big, work hard, and above all stay humble. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do and through our work together we hope to create a supportive, welcoming, and innovative environment. We strive to play as a team to win the world and create a better version of ourselves every day. If this sounds like something that excites you, we want to hear from you!



Check out more about life at Miro:


* Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/@lifeatmiro
* Blog: https://miro.com/careers/life-at-miro/all/
* Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mirohq/


At Miro, we strive to create and foster an environment of belonging and collaboration across cultural differences. Miro's mission — *Empower teams to create the next big thing* — is how we think about our product, people, and culture. We believe that creating big things requires diverse and inclusive teams. *Diversity* invites all talent with different demography, identities and styles *to step in*, and *inclusion* invites them to step *closer together.* Every day, we are working to build a more diverse Miro, cultivate a sense of belonging for future and current Mironeers around the world, and foster an environment where everyone can collaborate and embrace differences.


**Miro handles and uses personal data of job applicants in line with its** **Recruitment Privacy Policy** **found** **here****.**
company_description: Miro is a global company on a mission to change the way the world collaborates online. Wanna be a part of the collaboration revolution?

title: Finance & Control Analyst
description:
**Your role**
-------------


As a financial analyst, you have an eye for both accounting and finance. You have a strong product knowledge, and you are also aware of IFRS accounting principles.


You will work in a team to manage daily accounting. You will prepare daily and monthly reports. You will analyze and explain changes in the figures, and coordinate with Treasury and Risk. You will join cross-functional teams and represent Finance in projects during design, testing, and implementation stages.


You have affinity with finance and financial markets which will help you analyze FMO ledger and positions. You are assertive, eager to learn, and precise when interpreting data. You enjoy the financial complexity of our products and aim to enhance our financial reporting quality. You produce reports in which you draw conclusions and make recommendations. You want to know how we manage processes to ensure overall quality. You drive change and are continuously on the look-out for improvements. You can make yourself familiar with the complex environments we operate in. You are quick to translate current events into appropriate action.


We are looking for an enthusiastic financial analyst. You enjoy working in a diverse team and seek to improve processes and speed up execution.


**Our offer**
-------------

* A salary compensation of 55-65k annually
* Pension scheme, partly paid by FMO
* 31 holidays
* Working remotely abroad for 60 days in a rolling period of up to 12 months
* Hybrid way of working (50/50)


For more information, please visit our website Secondary Benefits - FMO


**Your team**
-------------


The Finance and Control team is part of the Finance, Impact & Data department. The team consists of 24 professionals, who are in charge of for daily Accounting, (Regulatory) Reporting, IFRS Policies and Controlling. Due to the team's international and diverse nature, team members primarily communicate in English.


**Your background**
-------------------


You thrive in a continuously changing environment. You excel as a team player and seek to build the F&C team in your next role. Do you think you match?


Financial markets are always evolving, which requires constantly fresh insights in the analysis we prepare. IT requirements and external regulations also change continuously. We are looking for your creativity and ideas that will make us better.


You are curious about underlying causes, you reason logically, and you have an eye for detail. You can clearly set out your interpretation of data in reports, and your advice is well-founded and precise. As a Financial Analyst , you enjoy working independently within your area of expertise. You want to understand the underlying issues and provide parties with accurate data and advice.


We are looking for an ambitious professional who combines knowledge with a hands-on mentality. You listen and ask questions. You have a helicopter view and are intrinsically excited to work in Finance.


* Master’s or bachelors degree in Business, Accounting (HBO accountancy, SPD), Controlling or similar degree.
* 0-2 years of experience in Finance/banking/audit.
* Knowledge of accounting principles, processes, and standards.
* Understanding balance sheet and P&L movement and drivers
* You are able to clearly express yourself towards co-workers and customers.
* Drive to continuously improve your own work environment and processes.
* Team player, positive attitude, willingness to learn.
* Strong verbal/writing skills in English


**Interested?**


Are you excited to join this challenging environment and believe you can succeed in this role? Then tell us your story. We are curious!

title: Informatie Manager bij het Munitiebedrijf van Defensie
description:
Functieomschrijving
-------------------


  
Werken bij het ministerie van Defensie maar niet als militair?



Word Informatie Manager bij het Munitiebedrijf van Defensie



Als je kiest voor een baan bij Defensie, dan kies je voor maatschappelijk relevant werk. Je draagt echt iets bij aan een veilig Nederland.



Naast 40.000 beroepsmilitairen werken er ook nog zo’n 16.000 burgers bij Defensie. Wil jij in je eigen vakgebied als burger bijdragen aan een professionele defensieorganisatie en daarmee aan vrede en veiligheid in binnen- en buitenland?



Als Informatie manager speel je een cruciale rol in het goed laten functioneren van het Informatie- en Datamanagement binnen DMUNB.



Wat ga je doen?


* Je bent de schakel tussen de centrale Defensie ICT afdeling (JIVC) en DMUNB. Op basis van jouw kennis en ervaring met het inrichten van Informatie- en Datamanagement (IDM) adviseer je over de toepassing van de IDM-kaders
* Je volgt relevante trends en ontwikkelingen op het vakgebied en formuleert het IDM standpunt namens het DMunB en draagt dit uit in de gerelateerde overlegfora
* Je informeert en adviseert afdelings- en sectiehoofden over de laatste IDM ontwikkelingen en je brengt in kaart welke behoeften er vanuit de verschillende afdelingen is
* Je analyseert en brengt behoeften en knelpunten in de data- en informatietools in kaart. Op basis van je analyse geef je advies aan afdelings- en sectiehoofden en de informatiemanager van COMMIT
* Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het inrichten van de informatiehuishouding, inclusief het autorisatiebeheer
* Samen met de Informatiespecialist verzorg je de instandhouding van de mappen en/of informatietegelstructuur
* Het beheren van applicaties die binnen DMUNB gebruikt worden en nog niet bij de centrale Defensie ICT afdeling zijn ondergebracht

  
Functie-eisen
-------------


  
Wat vragen we?


* Een afgeronde en voltooide HBO opleiding (voorkeursrichting Informatica);
* Ervaring met het inrichten en beheren van Informatie- en DataManagement domeinen en bedrijfsvoeringsprocessen
* Je bent ondernemend en werkt zelfstandig. Jij hebt niemand nodig om gedreven en initiatiefrijk te zijn, maar je voelt je ook op je plek en in een team met diverse experts;
* Sterke adviesvaardigheden en durft in te grijpen waar nodig

  
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
------------------


  
* Salarisniveau schaal 9
* Salarisomschrijving
Het genoemde salaris is gebaseerd op een volledige werkweek van 38 uur. Je inschaling wordt gebaseerd op je werkervaring en opleidingsachtergrond.
* Maandsalaris Min €3.583 – Max. €5.010 (bruto)
* Dienstverband Tijdelijke aanstelling met uitzicht op vaste aanstelling
* Contractduur Tijdelijke aanstelling met uitzicht op een vaste aanstelling.
* Maximaal aantal uren per week 38

  
Overige arbeidsvoorwaarden
--------------------------


  
Defensie hecht sterk aan persoonlijke groei en kent goede studiefaciliteiten, hierdoor sta je nooit stil. Je krijgt alle ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen en door te groeien.



Hoe leuk het werken bij Defensie ook is, wij vinden het ook belangrijk dat je dit met jouw privéleven kunt combineren. Diverse verlofregelingen (bijvoorbeeld 75% betaald ouderschapsverlof) en flexibele werktijden dragen bij aan een goede balans. En als dat niet genoeg is, dan is het ook nog mogelijk je werktijd (tijdelijk) enkele uren per week te verkorten en extra verlofuren en/of ADV-uren op te bouwen.



Buiten het salaris en vakantiegeld kun je rekenen op een eindejaarsuitkering van 8,3%, de zogeheten dertiende maand. Naast een pensioenregeling bij het ABP ontvang je maandelijks een tegemoetkoming voor woon-werkverkeer of kun je onder gunstige voorwaarden kiezen voor een OV-abonnement met onbeperkt reizen door heel Nederland.


  
Bijzonderheden
--------------


  
Visie  

Het Commando Materieel & IT (COMMIT) ondersteunt de transitie naar een informatiegestuurde en technologisch hoogwaardige krijgsmacht met het beste materieel en de beste IT. Ons COMMITment is groot om de cruciale rol te versterken als strategisch partner van de Commandant der Strijdkrachten, van de operationele onderdelen en van internationale partners. COMMIT vergroot de impact van de ondersteuning door een integrale en innovatieve aanpak van materieel- en IT-projecten, (wapen)systeemmanagement en ketenlogistiek.



Wij investeren in de kwaliteit van onze mensen en de flexibiliteit en diversiteit van het personeelsbestand. De belangrijkste capaciteiten van COMMIT zijn de kennis en ervaring van ons personeel. Om de krijgsmacht sneller te voorzien van materieel en IT zetten wij naast technologische innovatie in op proces- en sociale innovatie op het gebied van projectvoering, inkoop en afstoting van defensiematerieel en personele en logistieke ondersteuning.



Het uitvoeren van innovatieve projecten vraagt om meer samenwerking met het bedrijfsleven, kennisinstituten en andere overheidsorganisaties en maatschappelijke instanties. Onder de vlag van C-COMMIT als National Armaments Director (NAD) ontwikkelen en versterken wij ook de internationale samenwerking op het gebied van materieel en IT (NAVO, EU, multinationaal en bilateraal).



Missie  

COMMIT levert de krijgsmacht het beste materieel en de beste IT.


  
**Meer over jouw toekomstige afdeling**
---------------------------------------



Waar ga je werken?  

Je komt te werken in het team Bureau Besturing binnen het Munitiebedrijf van Defensie. Het team komt een aantal keer per week samen in Utrecht. Het is een gezellig, gedreven en competent team bestaande uit diverse experts, zoals (senior) bedrijfsanalisten, data experts, een informatie analist en een opleidingscoördinator. Het team zal worden uitgebreid naar 15 functies. Dit zal stapsgewijs gebeuren, zodat we onze nieuwe collega’s optimaal kunnen inwerken.  

Er is een prima werk-privé balans: de mogelijkheid om thuis te werken en je werkweek in overleg in te delen. Daarnaast krijg je de ruimte om de functie vorm te geven passend bij de functie inhoud.



**Ministerie van Defensie**
---------------------------



Defensie zet zich in voor de belangen, welvaart en vrijheid van Nederland. We zijn dagelijks actief in binnen- en buitenland. Onze wereldwijde inzet versterkt de internationale samenwerking en zorgt ervoor dat mensen zich in vrijheid kunnen ontplooien. Nu en in de toekomst.



Bij het ministerie van Defensie werken ongeveer 56.000 mensen direct en indirect aan vrede en veiligheid. Het ministerie bestaat uit het Commando Materieel & IT (COMMIT), de Bestuursstaf (het departement), de Koninklijke Marine, de Koninklijke Landmacht, de Koninklijke Luchtmacht, de Koninklijke Marechaussee, het Defensie Ondersteuningscommando (DOSCO).



**Stel gerust je vraag**
------------------------

### **Meer informatie over de sollicitatieprocedure**

Romee Hendriks 06-57650835

title: Demand Analyst
description:
**Company Description** **Avery Dennison Corporation** (NYSE: AVY) is a global materials science and digital identification solutions company that provides a wide range of branding and information solutions that optimize labor and supply chain efficiency, reduce waste, advance sustainability, circularity and transparency, and better connect brands and consumers. Our products and solutions include labeling and functional materials, radio frequency identification (RFID) inlays and tags, software applications that connect the physical and digital, and a variety of products and solutions that enhance branded packaging and carry or display information that improves the customer experience. Serving an array of industries worldwide — including home and personal care, apparel, general retail, e-commerce, logistics, food and grocery, pharmaceuticals and automotive — we employ approximately 35,000 employees in more than 50 countries. Our reported sales in 2023 were $8.4 billion. Learn more at www.averydennison.com.

*Please let us know if we can support you with reasonable accommodations throughout the application process by contacting our Talent Acquisition team via* ***Requestaccomodation@eu.averydennison.com****.*

*Avery Dennison is an equal-opportunity employer.*

 **Job Description** **About the Role:**


As a Demand Analyst, you will be a key player in our Supply Chain team, responsible for developing accurate and insightful demand forecasts that drive our business decisions. You will leverage your analytical prowess and data-driven approach to anticipate market trends, identify opportunities, and optimize inventory levels. This is a high-impact role where your insights will directly influence our production planning, inventory management, and sales strategies.


Key Responsibilities:

* Demand Forecasting: Develop and maintain robust demand forecast models utilizing statistical techniques, historical data, market intelligence, and collaborative input from cross-functional teams.
* Data Analysis and Insights: Analyze complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies. Extract actionable insights to drive continuous improvement in forecasting accuracy and inform strategic decision-making.
* Collaboration: Partner closely with Sales, Marketing, Operations, and Finance teams to understand their perspectives and incorporate relevant factors into your forecasts.
* Scenario Planning: Develop and evaluate demand scenarios to assess potential risks and opportunities, enabling proactive decision-making and risk mitigation strategies.
* Reporting and Communication: Prepare and present clear, concise, and insightful reports on demand forecasts, key trends, and potential risks to senior management.
* Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of the latest forecasting methodologies and technologies, identifying opportunities to enhance our forecasting processes and tools.

 **Qualifications*** **Education**: Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, Statistics, Economics, or a related quantitative field. Advanced degree (MBA, MS) preferred.
* **Experience**: 3+ years of experience in demand planning or forecasting, ideally in a global or multi-regional context.
* **Technical Skills**: Proficiency in statistical forecasting techniques and data analysis tools (e.g., R, Python, SQL). Experience with demand planning software (e.g., SAP APO, JDA) is a plus.
* **Analytical Mindset**: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to synthesize complex data into actionable recommendations.
* **Communication and Collaboration**: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders across different functions.
* **Business Acumen**: Understanding of key business drivers and their impact on demand, as well as the ability to translate data insights into strategic business decisions.

 **Additional Information**  

Additional information


AVERY DENNISON IS EVERYWHERE YOU LOOK:


We not only embrace change… we drive it. We work hard, push hard, and take brave risks. Our culture is innovative and collaborative - where bold ideas turn into action. We grow strong talent through stretch opportunities only restricted by your interests. We are committed to workplace diversity for employees and the business. We are a force for good, imbedded in industries and communities worldwide. We are challenging ourselves and others to reach higher and think bigger to improve the quality of all life. Avery Dennison is a great place to work for everyone. We offer:

* Workplace Flexibility,
* Structured learning and development
* Mentoring program
* Competitive total rewards
* Commitment to Sustainability


At Avery Dennison, we do what we love and we love what we do.

**Avery Dennison is an equal opportunity employer.**  

Please let us know if we can support you with reasonable accommodations throughout the application process by contacting our team via Requestaccomodation@eu.averydennison.com.

title: Data Analist
description:
**Dit is de Consumentenbond**

De Consumentenbond is er voor iedereen. Wij beschermen consumenten tegen bedrijven die misleiden of misbruik maken van hun macht. Zo maken we de wereld een beetje eerlijker. Wij maken geen winst, al onze inkomsten zetten we in voor ons werk voor consumenten. Zodat zij de beste keuze kunnen maken en krijgen waar ze recht op hebben.

**Dit ga je doen**

De organisatie relevante inzichten en stuurinformatie leveren op basis waarvan wij data gedreven beslissingen kunnen nemen. Dit doe je met behulp van (geavanceerde) analyses, geautomatiseerde dashboards en operationele rapporten.

* Samen met stakeholders vertaal jij de behoefte in informatie en inzichten zelfstandig de best passende business intelligence oplossing.
* Je doorgrondt bedrijfsprocessen en bron applicatie-functionaliteiten. Daarmee ontwerp, ontwikkel en implementeer je herbruikbare geautomatiseerde datamodellen.
* Je ontwerpt, ontwikkelt en implementeert datavisualisaties in gebruiksvriendelijke, interactieve, duidelijke management-dashboards, naast functionele en operationele rapporten.
* Je werkt nauw samen met een data-engineer bij het verkennen, ontwerpen, ontwikkelen en implementeren van (nieuwe) ETL / ELT datastromen op het dataplatform.
* Je duikt zelf in beschikbare data en adviseert gevraagd en ongevraagd stakeholders op basis van jou analyses. Je vertaalt deze analyses naar begrijpelijke en bruikbare inzichten die waarde toevoegen voor onze leden en een effectievere bedrijfsvoering.

**Met wie ga je samenwerken?**

Je werkt vanuit het gilde Data Analyse en Business Intelligence. Dit is een dynamische en veelzijdige groep mensen. Hun doel is de producten en diensten van de Consumentenbond iedere dag een beetje beter te maken.

Als Data Analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor de kwaliteit van de data-analyseprocessen, van de gegevensverzameling tot de presentatie van inzichten. Je staat er niet alleen voor want je bent onderdeel van een gedreven groep collega’s in een scrumteam. Dat team is verantwoordelijk voor het analyseren en interpreteren van data om strategische beslissingen te ondersteunen en bedrijfsprocessen te optimaliseren. In dit team werk je samen met data-engineers, business intelligence specialisten, scrum masters en product owners.

**Dit ben jij**

* Je bent een van de ambassadeurs voor onze data-gedreven organisatie.
* Je bent communicatief vaardig, servicegericht en diplomatiek.
* Het spreekt je aan om in een cultuur te werken waarbij zelfstandigheid en proactief handelen belangrijk zijn.
* Je kunt je goed verplaatsen in collega’s uit verschillende onderdelen van de organisatie.
* Je bent proactief en in staat om door je manier van samenwerken gemeenschappelijke doelen te bereiken.
* Je bent gericht op creatie, hebt vernieuwende ideeën, ziet snel de samenhang van zaken en hebt een snel begrip van processen.
* Je bezit daadkracht, gaat op een doortastende, onderzoekende wijze aan de slag en hebt overzicht over en structuur in je werkzaamheden.
* Je bent sterk analytisch ingesteld en beschikt over strategische kennis. Op basis van je eigen oordeel neem je daadkrachtige besluiten.
* Je streeft continu naar kennis, trekt gegronde conclusies en benadert problemen door het scheiden van hoofd- en bijzaken

**Verder breng je mee:**

* Aantoonbare werkervaring op HBO-niveau, bij voorkeur een afgeronde HEAO-BE of BI opleiding.
* Minimaal 4 jaar aantoonbare ervaring met tools uit Microsoft BI stack, PowerBi, PowerQuery, (T)SQL en DAX.
* Ervaring met ERP en finance applicatie migraties en implementaties is een pré.
* Kennis van Python is een pré.

**Zo werken wij**

De Consumentenbond heeft een platte organisatiestructuur. We werken sinds een paar jaar zelforganiserend, op basis van holacratische principes. Dit betekent dat we geen functieprofielen hebben, maar flexibele rollen. Daardoor is onze organisatie wendbaar en actiegericht. Elke rol heeft een eigen doel en eigen verantwoordelijkheden. Je kunt meerdere rollen tegelijk op je nemen en meerdere collega’s kunnen dezelfde rol vervullen.

**Wat bieden wij?**

* Een rol binnen een organisatie die écht impact maakt.
* Salaris vanaf €3.881 tot maximaal €6.076 bruto per maand bij een fulltime dienstverband, inschaling is mede afhankelijk van je werkervaring.
* Aantrekkelijke arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals 35 verlofdagen en een eindejaarsuitkering.
* Een frisse, open werkomgeving met flexplekken, op 5 minuten lopen van station Den Haag HS.
* De kans je vakmanschap in te zetten en hiermee honderdduizenden consumenten te helpen.
* Een jaarcontract met uitzicht op een vast contract bij goed functioneren en gelijkblijvende economische omstandigheden.

**Contactpersoon**  
Voor aanvullende informatie over deze functie neem je contact op met Doğu Colak. Bel of whatsapp hem via 06-38 71 14 96 of stuur een e-mail naar dcolak@consumentenbond.nl.

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime

Salaris: €3.881,00 - €6.076,00 per maand

Rooster:

* Dagdienst
* ma-vr

Secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden:

* Budget voor professionele ontwikkeling
* Dienstreizen vergoeding
* Extra vakantiedagen
* Flexibele werkuren
* Pensioen
* Reiskostenvergoeding
* Werk vanuit huis

* Vakantiegeld

* Nederlands (Vereist)

title: Business Intelligence Analist
description:
**Business Intelligence Analyst** 

Do you have a passion for designing and creating powerful and insightful reports and APIs? Do you want to work with the latest BI technologies and collaborate with a dedicated team of experts? Then you might be the perfect candidate for the position of BI Analyst at our client.

**About Our Client**

At Our Client, the principle of "people first" is central, a belief deeply rooted in their identity. We recognize the immense power of people, which drives our commitment to both our employees and customers. Our mission is to transform complex organizational tasks into user-friendly software accessible to everyone. At Our Client, we not only develop software tools; we create solutions that enrich businesses and society by achieving more with less effort.

**What does the role of Business Intelligence Analyst consist of?**

As a BI Analyst, you will be part of the Business Intelligence and Data Analytics team, where you report to the BI Team Lead and deliver high-quality reporting solutions using AWS technologies.

In this role, you play a crucial part by being responsible for analyzing, creating, and transforming large datasets to generate actionable business insights. You oversee the design and implementation of a scalable and integrated reporting architecture, ensure seamless data integration, and maintain accuracy in reporting. Your efforts will focus on data analysis, creating reports, and enhancing our client API.

You will have intensive contact with our users and internal stakeholders, including consultants, developers, and our product manager, to assist them further and proactively collect feedback to continuously improve our software and find optimal solutions through data analysis. Due to these responsibilities, it is essential that you have excellent communication skills, feeling comfortable speaking and writing in English. It is a challenging role in which you will make a significant contribution to the further development and success of our client BI software.

**What do we ask of you?**

* Excellent communication skills with the ability to simplify complex tasks and translate them into practical business insights and solutions
* You are analytical, detail-oriented, and have a strong preference for creating excellent documentation
* You collaborate well with others, working with internal teams to find solutions, but also have no problem independently tackling and completing tasks
* You have the ability to translate technical data insights into easily understandable information for both technical and non-technical audiences
* You are eager to share the knowledge you have gained from your analyses with the team and the rest of the organization, including customers
* Strong experience with data storage, data modeling, and analytical techniques, creating complex reports and dashboards
* Experience with reporting tools such as Amazon Quicksight, Power BI, Tableau
* You have the ability to gather, interpret, identify gaps, and translate business reporting needs into reporting solutions, dashboards, reports, and insights for our customers
* Experience with developing and optimizing SQL queries is desirable but not essential
* Contribute to strategic decision-making to improve efficiency and customer experience
* Familiarity with how APIs work and the ability to create functional API requirements is desirable but not essential.

**About Our Client**

At Our Client, the principle of "people first" is central, a belief deeply rooted in their identity. We recognize the immense power of people, which drives our commitment to both our employees and customers. Our mission is to transform complex organizational tasks into user-friendly software accessible to everyone. At Our Client, we not only develop software tools; we create solutions that enrich businesses and society by achieving more with less effort.

**What do we offer you as a Business Intelligence Analyst?**

The Product Development Organization within our Client and consists of eight international teams. As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be part of this wonderful organization and join the Business Intelligence and Data Analytics team. You will find yourself in a no-nonsense culture, where you are seen as a person, and where helping and supporting each other is central: "Together we achieve more than alone". The Product Development team faces many challenges in a growing market, where we make smart choices together. You will have the opportunity to shape and execute your tasks independently and help us succeed in delivering reporting capabilities to our customers. Within Our Client, there are many opportunities for further development, career advancement, and growth in a variety of roles. On certain days, the option to work remotely is available, complemented by the opportunity to come to the office.

**Employment:** 32-40 hours  
Plenty of opportunities for professional and personal development.  
Above-average employment conditions with a salary between € 4,500 - 6,000 gross per month, depending on experience.

Interested? Contact Charles from Guidewell @ 06 19 69 81 77 or send an email to info@guidewell.nl

Salaris: €4.500,00 - €6.000,00 per maand

title: ESG Business Analyst
Data management consultant
description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een dynamische en veelzijdige Data Consultant om ons team te versterken. De ideale kandidaat beschikt over een unieke combinatie van consultancyvaardigheden, projectmanagementexpertise en een verkoopgerichte mentaliteit, samen met een diepgaand begrip van datamanagement en datastrategieprincipes. Deze rol vereist een individu die zich moeiteloos kan aanpassen aan diverse projecten en klantbehoeften, en zakelijke successen kan stimuleren door middel van effectieve datastrategieën.

Als Data & Strategy Consultant bij adesso speel je een cruciale rol in het helpen van onze klanten om het volledige potentieel van hun data te benutten. Deze functie vraagt om een professional die niet alleen de fijne kneepjes van datamanagement begrijpt, maar ook uitblinkt in projectmanagement en business development. Jouw primaire verantwoordelijkheid zal zijn om de kloof te overbruggen tussen technische data-oplossingen en zakelijke doelstellingen, zodat onze klanten weloverwogen, data-gedreven beslissingen kunnen nemen.

**Belangrijkste Verantwoordelijkheden:**

**Consultancy & Klantbetrokkenheid:**

* Fungeren als een vertrouwde adviseur voor klanten, waarbij je hun zakelijke behoeften begrijpt en op maat gemaakte datamanagement- en strategische oplossingen biedt.
* Workshops en bijeenkomsten faciliteren om eisen te verzamelen, bevindingen te presenteren en actiegerichte strategieën aan te bevelen.
* Sterke klantrelaties opbouwen en onderhouden om nieuwe zakelijke kansen te identificeren en te benutten.

**Projectmanagement:**

* Leiding geven aan en beheren van datamanagementprojecten van start tot finish, waarbij je zorgt voor tijdige levering en naleving van budget- en kwaliteitsnormen.
* Projectplannen ontwikkelen, middelen toewijzen en de voortgang bewaken om projectdoelen te bereiken.
* Coördineren met multifunctionele teams, waaronder data-ingenieurs, analisten en andere consultants, om uitgebreide data-oplossingen te leveren.

**Expertise in Datamanagement:**

* Inzichten en begeleiding bieden over datagovernance, datastrategie en data-architectuur om ervoor te zorgen dat best practices worden gevolgd.
* Beoordelingen uitvoeren van bestaande datamanagementprocessen en verbeteringen aanbevelen.
* Op de hoogte blijven van trends en ontwikkelingen in de sector om de dienstverlening voortdurend te verbeteren.

**Verkoop & Business Development:**

* Potentiële use cases identificeren en leads genereren door middel van strategisch netwerken.
* Overtuigende presentaties en voorstellen voorbereiden en leveren om nieuwe klanten te werven.
* Samenwerken met het verkoopteam om verkoopstrategieën te ontwikkelen en uit te voeren die aansluiten bij de bedrijfsdoelstellingen.

**Flexibiliteit & Aanpassingsvermogen:**

* Aanpassen aan verschillende projectvereisten en klantomgevingen, met flexibiliteit in aanpak en uitvoering.
* Een continue leermentaliteit omarmen om effectief in te spelen op evoluerende zakelijke uitdagingen.

**Kwalificaties:**

* Bachelor- of Masterdiploma in Bedrijfskunde, Informatiekunde, Computerwetenschappen of een gerelateerd vakgebied.
* Minimaal 3 jaar relevante werkervaring in een dataomgeving in een rol zoals data-analist, consultant met een focus op datamanagement of soortgelijk.
* Minimaal 2 jaar werkervaring bij een top consultancybureau in Nederland in rollen zoals Consultant, Projectmanager of soortgelijk.
* Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels, zowel geschreven als gesproken.
* Sterke projectmanagementvaardigheden, met een bewezen staat van dienst in het succesvol leiden en opleveren van complexe projecten.
* Verkoopvaardigheden met het vermogen om zakelijke groei te stimuleren.
* Diepgaand begrip van datamanagementconcepten, waaronder datagovernance en datastrategie.
* Uitzonderlijke communicatie- en interpersoonlijke vaardigheden, met het vermogen om belanghebbenden op alle niveaus te betrekken en te beïnvloeden.
* Hoge mate van flexibiliteit en aanpassingsvermogen.

title: Business Analist
description:
Functieomschrijving
-------------------


  
Help de juiste beslissingen te nemen over belangrijke vraagstukken, voor een betere en toegankelijkere rechtspraak!



De Rechtspraak is volop in beweging. Zo zetten we maximaal in op digitalisering en toegankelijkheid. Als business analist duik je in actuele vraagstukken en schets je daar een haarscherp beeld van. Hoe functioneert de rechtspraak? Waar kan het beter? En hoe? Zo leg je de basis voor weloverwogen beslissingen en belangrijke veranderingen. Een baan met een enorme maatschappelijke impact dus!



Hoe je werk eruit ziet



Je werkt vanuit een vakgroep met ruim 15 analisten. Elk kwartaal maken jullie een planning: welke onderwerpen pakken we aan en op welke rechtsgebieden? Onderzoeksopdrachten kunnen over applicaties, werkprocessen of data gaan. Zo zijn we onder meer bezig met ‘de tijdige rechtspraak’. Waar treedt vertraging op in het rechtspraakproces? En wat kunnen we eraan doen, zonder dat dit ten koste gaat van de kwaliteit?



Om input over vraagstukken op te halen, organiseer je workshops voor interne én externe partijen. Intern zijn dat bijvoorbeeld rechters, administraties of juristen. Extern kun je denken aan advocaten, deurwaarders of bewindvoerders. Die input werk je uit in een analyse die je valideert bij alle betrokkenen en eventueel een klankbordgroep die je zelf hebt opgezet. Vervolgens ga je om de tafel met onder meer IT-analisten en ontwikkelaars. Hoe geven we de nodige veranderingen vorm? Ook maak je kwantitatieve en kwalitatieve analyses van het gebruik van informatiesystemen. Hoe intensief is het gebruik? Hoe werkt het systeem en voldoet het aan de behoefte van de gebruikers?



Iedere week kom je samen met je collega-analisten om de voortgang te bespreken en kennis te delen. Op elke opdracht zitten twee analisten, dus je hebt altijd een directe sparringpartner. Jullie werken agile, maken gebruik van methodes zoals design thinking en business model canvas (BMC) en besteden veel aandacht aan de user experience. Kortom, echte business analisten van deze tijd! Als business analist werk je voor een specifiek rechtsgebied, in dit geval voor strafrecht.



Zie jij voor ieder vraagstuk meerdere oplossingen? Kun je goed met heel verschillende mensen overweg? En weet je dingen voor elkaar te krijgen? Dan zou jij wel eens de business analist kunnen zijn die wij zoeken!


  
Functie-eisen
-------------


  
Dit zijn de dingen waar je volgens het ideaalplaatje aan voldoet:



Je hebt een wo-opleiding op het raakvlak van bedrijfskunde of bestuurskunde en/of informatica afgerond;  

Je hebt ruime werkervaring;  

Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met moderne methodes en technieken toe, zoals design thinking, business model canvas en ‘lean’ werken;  

Je bent een verbinder die de communicatie opzoekt;  

Ervaring met of kennis van het strafrecht is een pre;  

Kom je bij ons werken, dan vragen we ook altijd een Verklaring Omtrent het Gedrag (VOG).


  
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
------------------


  
* Salarisniveau schaal 11
* Maandsalaris Min €4.024 – Max. €6.110 (bruto)
* Dienstverband Arbeidsovereenkomst voor onbepaalde tijd
* Contractduur Zie vacaturetekst
* Minimaal aantal uren per week 32
* Maximaal aantal uren per week 36

  
Overige arbeidsvoorwaarden
--------------------------


  
Om te beginnen een leuke, informele werksfeer. We houden de lijnen graag kort! En je arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn prima geregeld volgens de CAO Rijk. Wat belangrijke punten op een rij:


* Je salaris is maximaal € 6.110,94 op basis van 36-urige werkweek. Je zit in schaal 11.
* Je krijgt een Individueel Keuze Budget (IKB) van maximaal € 1008 bruto per maand (16,5%). Dit is inclusief je vakantiegeld en eindejaarsuitkering. Je kunt dit budget bijvoorbeeld laten uitkeren of omzetten in vrije dagen.
* Je houdt werk en privé prima in balans, bijvoorbeeld door hybride te werken (minimaal 2 dagen op locatie) of ouderschapsverlof. Er zijn talloze vergoedingen voor het inrichten van je thuiswerkplek.
* Je krijgt 26 vakantiedagen op basis van een 36-urige werkweek.
* Binnen de IVO Academy krijg je alle ruimte en is er volop aandacht voor jouw persoonlijke én vaktechnische ontwikkeling.
* Bij IVO Rechtspraak stimuleren we reizen met het OV! Je krijgt een OV-chipkaart waarmee je gratis voor je werk reist.
* Je pensioen is goed geregeld via het ABP.
* Je krijgt in eerste instantie een jaarcontract. Functioneer je goed, dan wordt dit een contract voor onbepaalde tijd.
* Gezellige uitjes, zoals een teamdag, zomer bbq, donderdag middagborrel, eindejaarsfeest etc.


Meer informatie over onze arbeidsvoorwaarden vind je op www.p-direkt.nl.


  
Bijzonderheden
--------------


  
Is een baan als business analist iets voor jou? Reageer dan via onderstaande button.



Meer weten? Bel Peter Versteeg, hr-adviseur, via 06 3168 4603.



IVO Rechtspraak  

Uniceflaan 1  

3527 WX Utrecht


  
**IVO Rechtspraak**
-------------------



Rechtspraak raakt iedereen. Juist dát maakt jouw werk zo belangrijk. IVO Rechtspraak is een bijzondere werkgever. Onze 800 collega’s ontwikkelen en beheren up-to-date digitale systemen voor de rechtspraak. Met slimme oplossingen zorgen we ervoor dat rechtszaken iedere dag soepel verlopen. Niet alleen voor de 12.000 medewerkers die rechtszaken behandelen. Ook voor miljoenen Nederlanders die met de Rechtspraak te maken hebben. IVO Rechtspraak is een leuke, informele werkgever. We houden de lijnen graag kort!



IVO Rechtspraak

title: Data Engineer
description:
* Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes to ingest, process, and analyze large volumes of data.
* Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and implement solutions that meet business needs.
* Develop and optimize data models, ensuring data quality, integrity, and performance.
* Implement data security and privacy measures to protect sensitive information.
* Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines to ensure reliability and efficiency.
* Stay updated on emerging technologies and best practices in data engineering and recommend new tools and techniques to enhance our data infrastructure.


  

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field.
* 3+ years of experience in data engineering or a related role in programming languages such as Python, Scala, or Java.
* Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts and technologies (e.g., SQL, NoSQL, Hadoop, Spark).
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
* Knowledge of data integration tools and techniques (e.g., Apache Airflow, Kafka).
* Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills and collaboration abilities.


Nice to Have:


* Experience with machine learning and big data analytics.
* Knowledge of DevOps practices and tools for data engineering (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies.

title: Data Analist
description:
**Een rol met impact:** die heb je als Data Analist bij 123inkt.nl
  
  

Data inzichtelijk maken is helemaal jouw ding. Jij vindt logica in een wirwar van cijfers, je brengt structuur aan en brengt data tot leven in heldere rapportages. En dat allemaal bij een van de toonaangevende webwinkels van Nederland!
  
  

Wat ga je doen?
  
  

123inkt.nl groeit hard en hiermee groeit ook de vraag naar inzichtelijke data. Je duikt niet alleen in de data van 123inkt.nl, maar ook van onze andere shops wereldwijd. Je haalt de juiste dataset uit de SQL-database, verwerkt deze en vertaalt dit naar een duidelijke rapportage in onze BI-tool (Power BI). Met je scherpe analytische blik creëer je overzicht uit chaos en adviseer je verschillende teams binnen het bedrijf. Je speelt een cruciale rol in het automatiseren van processen, waardoor we slimmer en efficiënter kunnen werken. Jouw inzichten stellen 123inkt.nl nog beter in staat om risico’s in te schatten en beslissingen te nemen.
  
  

We zijn een zelfstandige afdeling, maar werken nauw samen met allerlei andere afdelingen en hebben onderling dan ook veel contact. Samen met de andere Data Analisten zoeken we naar oplossingen, helpen we elkaar bij query’s en dashboards en bedenken we gave dingen. Heb je zelf goede ideeën of initiatieven waardoor we nog slimmer naar de data kunnen kijken? Dan is er altijd ruimte om dat te onderzoeken. Dankzij de open, informele sfeer voel je je snel thuis bij ons.
  
  

Wat vragen wij?Je hebt een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding, het liefst in de richting van Business of IT.Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring. Je hebt ervaring met SQL en BI-tools (zoals Power BI).Je bent analytisch ijzersterk, herkent snel patronen en je bent commercieel ingesteld.
  
  

Je spreekt en schrijft uitstekend Nederlands en Engels.
  
  

Wat bieden wij?Een uitdagende functie in een sterk groeiend bedrijf.De kans om je verder te ontwikkelen.Uitstekend salaris en een aantrekkelijke pensioenregeling (wij betalen 75% van de premie).Mogelijkheid tot reiskostenvergoeding.25 vakantiedagen o.b.v. fulltime dienstverband.Flexibele werktijden.Extra's zoals personeelskorting, massage en gezonde lunches.
  
  

Sluit je aan bij ons datateam en help ons de toekomst te vormen!
  
  

Wat een leuke functie he? We verwachten deze dan ook zelf te kunnen invullen. Acquisitie vinden we zonde van jouw én onze tijd.

title: Solutions Engineer (Emerging Enterprises & Digital Natives)
description:
**Req ID FEQ225R124**



At Databricks, our core values are at the heart of everything we do; creating a culture of proactiveness and a customer-centric mindset guides us to create a unified platform that makes data science and analytics accessible to everyone. We aim to inspire our customers to make informed decisions that push their business forward. We provide a user-friendly and intuitive platform that makes it easy to turn insights into action and fosters a culture of creativity, experimentation, and continuous improvement. You will be an essential part of this mission, using your technical skills to demonstrate how our Data Intelligence Platform can help customers solve their complex data challenges.



You will report to a Field Engineering Director in the region and work with a collaborative, customer-focused team that values innovation and creativity, using your skills to create customized solutions to help our customers achieve their goals and guide their businesses forward.



Join us in our quest to change how people work with data and make a better world!


**Notes on mandatory requirements:**


* The location for the role must be in Amsterdam (or within a commutable distance for a hybrid schedule).
* Flexibility to travel (up to 20-30% as required for customer meetings, events and training).
* Business proficiency in both Dutch and English is required as a minimum. Fluency in additional regional languages may be advantageous.


**The impact you will have:**


* Learn from a Senior Solutions Architect and work with a team to sell Databricks solutions.
* Promote our platform to the technical community through workshops, events, and partnerships with the Databricks team.
* Gain hands-on experience by working on technical projects, understanding customer needs, and delivering solutions that solve their problems.
* Develop technical skills to work on data projects from ingestion to insight creation and prediction.
* Grow into an independent Senior Solutions Engineer by developing technical and pre-sales skills.


**What we look for:**


* Strong skills in effective communication, answering customer questions, aligning with their interests and achieving tangible results.
* Excitement for technical discovery, ability to gather requirements through effective questioning, research solutions, and present proofs-of-concept to an audience.
* Ability to identify and communicate the business value of technical solutions.
* Hands-on experience with a core programming language, Python or SQL. Apache Spark skills will be advantageous for the role.
* Knowledgeable in the Big Data Analytics domain with some exposure to advanced proofs-of-concept
* Hands-on skills with public cloud platform(s) - experience with the **AWS (Amazon Web Services) platform is a key requirement.**
* Cloud certifications in AWS and Databricks will be advantageous.


**Benefits**


* Medical insurance reimbursement or collective healthcare scheme
* Accident and income protection insurance
* Pension Plan
* Enhanced Parental Leaves
* Equity awards
* Fitness reimbursement
* Annual career development fund
* Home office & work headphones reimbursement
* Business travel accident insurance
* Mental wellness resources
* Employee referral bonus

**About Databricks**



Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.


**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**



At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.


**Compliance**


**If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.**

title: Software Engineer (Back-End) | Talent Program
description:
**Let’s talk talent**  
You have talent. Ready to make impact. We know. We also know that making impact starts with that first contact between likeminded people who have the same drive to shape their future. We see you, with your skills, personality and dreams. Now let’s take it to even greater heights by means of one of our talent programs for master’s and PhD graduates.

We are Mploy Associates, a talent focused consultancy firm ready to make not only our clients’ teams successful but also you. Your talent, our focus.

**More specifically?**  
We are a consultancy firm specialized in the areas of data, finance, and analytics and work on a variety of projects like investment analyses, data engineering, quant modelling and much more. Our clients are banks, insurance companies, asset managers and we are still expanding.

We help our clients build successful teams by providing the right skills, talents and know-how at the right place and time and develop ourselves continuously to stay successful. We believe that investing in talent through proven methods always pays out. Today we are proud to say that we are an international driven company with more than 100 people and many top-tier clients who share the same vision.

**How do you fit into this vision?**  
You will work as a Back-End Software Engineer for one of our clients with a special focus on your own development through one of our Talent Programs. Our Talent Programs are designed to accelerate your career from entry level to medior+ level within 24 months. By means of certified training courses, coaching and intervision sessions our employees follow an above average steep career curve. Successful graduation in our Talent Programs usually results in a permanent medior+ or senior position at one of our clients or where it becomes your responsibility to keep the team successful.

**Your activities as a Back-End Software Engineer**

Developing data pipelines and warehouses, configuring application environments and improving existing time-critical processes with a focus on continuous integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD) are on the core of this position. Your day-to-day responsibilities include:

* Aligning with business analysts for backlog refinements;
* ·Investigation of current implementations and solutions and improving these to new standards;
* Designing, developing and testing innovative solutions in a variety of coding languages;
* Implementation of future proof security standards;
* Improving and expanding CD/CI pipelines by enhancing automated testing methods.

On average you work 36 hours a week on a client project and you spend 4 hours a week on your own personal, professional and technical development in one of our Talent Programs.

**What are we looking for?**  
We are looking for graduates with different IT related backgrounds, experiences, and passions. It speaks for itself that you are ambitious, self-reflective and dare to be confident in an authentic way.

Furthermore, you are energized by stakeholder management and are well adept at gathering reliable information. You use this in combination with a consultive mindset to make our clients more successful. Last but not least, you are eager to develop yourself on personal, professional and technical level with our personalized in-house Talent Programs. To make it more specific:

* You have 0-3 years of work experience and want to learn everything about back-end software engineering;
* You want to put the skills into practice that you have acquired during your bachelor's or master’s in Computer Science or another IT related study;
* You have good knowledge of the design and development of back-end components (e.g. REST APIs, integrations, micro-services);
* You are familiar with one or more general operating systems (e.g. Linux, Unix, Windows), cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS, Google Cloud) and common programming languages (e.g., Java, SQL, Python, C#);
* You are able to troubleshoot complex software and hardware issues;
* You know your way around databases and network security systems.

**What do we offer?**  
We offer the opportunity to become an expert in software engineering in an environment where we train you to excel as a high-end professional. In addition, good working conditions are equally as important to us.

By offering free lunch at the office and regular fun team activities like escape rooms and fun dinners, we ensure a connected and social workplace. Also important; we will provide you with a public transport card and/or (electric) bike. All on us of course. Furthermore:

* A salary of €3,616 for bachelor’s and master's graduates, including holiday allowance and 13th month salary;
* Challenging work and projects for one of our top 200 clients;
* 25 days of paid annual leave;
* Half-day a week in-house professional and technical training combined with personal coaching;
* Besides in-house training opportunities, an external development budget of €2,000 per year to obtain relevant certifications as FRM or CFA;
* An international working environment with driven and ambitious colleagues from all over the world;
* The opportunity to take your next career move as a medior at the client or Mploy Associates after successfully completing your development program;
* Pro bono technical projects at socially relevant NGOs.

**Interested?**  
For more information about our different positions and Talent Programs you can visit our website www.mployassociates.com. Want to know more about the vacancy? Use the apply button above or send us an email from the moment you start your master’s so we can help you prepare for your dream career. We will be in touch.

Please note that unfortunately there is no point in applying when you do not live in the Netherlands or if you have more than 3 years of work experience. These applications will not be processed.

Are you interested in multiple positions at Mploy Associates? Apply for one position and mention the other position(s) in your motivation message. Together we will find the best match for you.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From €3.600,00 per month

Application Question(s):

* Are you willing to undergo a background check, in accordance with local law/regulations?
* Are you living in the Netherlands?
* Are you fulltime available?
* Do you have less than three years of relevant work experience?

Education:

* Master's (Required)

Language:

* English (Required)

Work authorization:

* Netherlands (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in 3512 LP Utrecht

title: Senior Azure Developer
description:
**Do you want to help shape crucial information products? That contribute to decision-making at the highest level of the bank. We enable the more than 15,000 users of our products in different areas of the bank, to make tactical and strategic choices every day. All while working in a dynamic and international environment. You will contribute the bank to become more data-driven.**

**You and your job**  

Your job focusses on extracting value from the product systems and convert it into actionable insights. Working together with about 40 fellow BI developers, BI Translators and Full Stack developers. Your team is part of an area which helps to create insights into all the spearpoints of the bank such as digitalisation, Cost control, Sustainability, Risk, and delivering accessibility for both the central bank and local banks. All these responsibilities contribute to the decision-making process up to the highest level in the bank.


With the CFO teams in the Business Intelligence area, we deliver management information in regards to customer profitability, ESG, Cost insights. And we support analysts with information overviews and dashboards to perform their job as efficiently as possible. Each team consists of about 8 colleagues and is a mix of analysts and developers. All teams are very collegial and results driven!

**Top 3 responsibilities**

* Designing and developing new solutions in the Microsoft Azure stack, such as Azure Data Factory, Azure DevOps deployment pipelines, Synapse Analytics, Azure Analysis Services, Power BI, etc.
* Working together on new innovative solutions for complex business needs.
* Developing scalable data products to support and accelerate Self-Service Business Intelligence and data informed decision-making processes.

**Facts & figures**

* International & diverse team
* Part of the CITO Risk & Finance Tech / Data Foundation with over 300 data minded professionals
* You serve 15000+ colleagues with information

43,822 Rabobank colleagues around the world  
* 

**You recognize yourself from the description below:**

* 7+ years working experience as Senior Developer with in depth knowledge on .NET (C#)
* Hands on experience with Azure Cloud services.
* Knowledge about architecting and developing maintainable and scalable software
* Excellent communication skills and a team player
* Experience in international IT projects English speaking and writing, (Dutch nice to have)
* Experience with the Agile way of working
* Experience with Azure DevOps
* Curious, analytic, pro-active, determined, result driven and not afraid to share his/her opinion

**Required:**

* Azure Cloud solutions (Azure App Services, Azure Functions, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks)
* C# (.NET Core/.NET 7 and higher)
* ASP.NET Core
* SQL, SQL Database / DWH
* Azure DevOps, GIT, CI/CD
* OOP principles, SOLID, DDD, Design Patterns
* Entity Framework (Core)
* Web API’s / Swagger/ REST / Open API
* Unit Testing / TDD / Mocking Frameworks

**Nice to have:**

* Experience with YAML, Azure CLI, PowerShell
* Experience with Microservices
* Experience with finance or banking systems and processes

**This is what we offer you**


* a gross monthly salary between € 4.292,- and € 6.130,- (scale 9, 36 hours per week).
* 13th month and holiday pay: the holiday allowance and annual allowance will usually be paid out in 12 equal monthly instalments. Employees have the option once a year to opt for the holiday allowance to be paid out in May and the annual allowance in December.
* an Employee Benefit Budget (11% of your monthly salary). You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions, or even receiving a monthly cash pay-out.
* an annual personal development/training budget of € 1.400,-
* 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport! Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a commuting allowance.
* a monthly € 40,- net work from home allowance, based on working from home 5 days per week.
* a monthly € 40,- net internet allowance.
* Attractive pension fund with a personal contribution of only 5.5%. Rabobank will contribute 21.5%.

This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Data Engineer / BI Developer based on a 36-hour working week (40 hours possible). You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.


**You and the job application process**


* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Dino Dzankovic, IT Recruiter, via dino.dzankovic@rabobank.nl
* We will hold the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on https://rabobank.jobs/en/faq
* A security check is part of the process.
